newsitem.title: USA: Complete Business backs 25-30 pct revenue growth.
newsitem.headline: Complete Business backs 25-30 pct revenue growth.

text.p: Complete Business Solutions Inc said Monday it is comfortable with analysts' estimates for revenue growth of 25 to 30 percent.

"Altogether, we are comfortable with the analysts' estimates for our top-line growth of 25 to 30 percent, with potential growth in net income outpacing that if margins continue to increase," Tim Manney, executive vice president of financial and administration, said in a statement.
Earlier, Complete Business reported first quarter net income of $0.15 a share, up from $0.09 a year ago. Sales rose about 27 percent to $24.3 million from $19.1 million.

"Our solid revenue growth and the change in our business mix toward higher-margin services was the driving factor in last quarter's strong profits, and why we exceeded analysts' earnings estimates by one to two cents per share," Raj Vattikuti, president, said in a statement.
For the first quarter, the operating margin rose to 7.3 percent from 6.4 percent a year ago. The pro forma net margin was 4.9 percent, up from 3.6 percent.
Complete Business provides information technology services.
